availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Albert G. H. Rice (Lewis County, Kentucky, farmer and shoemaker)

body.p: Lewis County, Kentucky, jailer, farmer, and shoemaker. Kentucky native. Son of Elijah Rice and Sarah Rice. Married to Jallina J. Rice in Carter County, Kentucky, on February 17, 1853. Father of James F. Rice, Orlando Rice, and George A. Rice. Farmer in Carter County in 1850. Shoemaker in Lewis County in 1860. Jailer of the Lewis County Jail in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 1, p. 258A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, p. 934.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Flemingsburg, p. 389A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994030, Carter County Marriages, p. 14.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994030, Carter County Births, p. 5.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Owen County Administration Bonds, 1830-1869, p. 108-09.
KYR-0001-021-0018.
